entry.title: DEVIL’S KNOB FIRE NOW 86 PERCENT CONTAINED
entry.summary: September 22, 2024 2:00 p.m. The Devil’s Knob Fire is 86 percent contained as of midday Sunday. Complex Incident Management Team NW 13 transitioned management of the fire to a smaller Type 3 team on Saturday night. Crews are completing mop up operations and will continue patrolling, monitoring, and conducting suppression repair where needed. The...

entry.title: Get to know Douglas ESD: Building student success
entry.summary: Student success is a priority for public school districts in Douglas County. To support this goal, Douglas Education Service District provides ongoing training for educators. This complements the outstanding work already taking place within 48 schools across the county.

entry.title: Anniversary: Bill and Barbara Woolstenhulme
entry.summary: Bill F. and Barbara L. Woolstenhulme celebrate their 70th wedding anniversary Sept. 24.

entry.title: Made in Douglas County-BL Performance: a business inspired by love and tragedy

entry.title: Growing coast redwoods in Umpqua earns the Hubers Tree Farmer of the Year

entry.title: ODF Incident Management Teams' Commitment to Oregon (Photo)
entry.summary: Salem, Ore. – This week marked the 12th deployment for the Oregon Department of Forestry’s incident management teams (IMT)—11 during fire season and one following the ice storm earlier this year. An IMT is a group of specially trained and qualified personnel who together provide the type of highly adaptable and coordinated infrastructure necessary to manage elements associated with all types of emergencies. ODF’s three Type 1 IMTs are qualified to handle the most complex incidents and deploy all throughout Oregon, nationally and internationally to provide help when it is desperately needed. The 1955 fire season revealed a gap in Oregon’s wildfire response capacity—a trained, qualified team of people able to come in and handle major fires when the incident management needs exceeded the ca…

entry.title: Celebrate Vaux's swifts migration

entry.title: Baker Charter Academy sees growth in Oregon

entry.title: Information about buck killing sought by OSP
entry.summary: ROCK CREEK — Oregon State Police fish and wildlife troopers are seeking those responsible for unlawfully killing and wasting a buck deer Thursday in Rock Creek.
